description: Heraklion was the harbor city of ancient Knossos, and was later re-founded by the Arab conquerors.

names.details: This is the Arabic name given to the newly-founded harbor-city in the ninth century AD. It later developed into "Candia" under Venetian rule.

history.comment: Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012

names.description: The name of the city under Venetian rule.
names.details: The name given by the Venetians, that became soon used for the whole island of Crete, derived from the previous Arabic name.

names.description: The name of the city under Ottoman rule (adaptation of the Venetian name of Candia in Ottoman Turkish)

history.comment: Kandiye was the name of the city under Ottoman rule, between 1669-1898. There is no preselected time period corresponding to these years, so I chose "Early Ottoman Empire", which is not correct.
